segment.source: Log File Locations for Data-Collection Packages (Windows 10)
segment.target: Log File Locations for Data-Collection Packages (Windows 10)

segment.source: Log File Locations for Data-Collection Packages
segment.target: Log File Locations for Data-Collection Packages

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: When you create a data-collection package in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can select an output location for your log files.
segment.target: When you create a data-collection package in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can select an output location for your log files.

segment.source: You have the following options:
segment.target: You have the following options:

segment.source: Specify an ACT Log Processing Service (LPS) share.
segment.target: Specify an ACT Log Processing Service (LPS) share.

segment.source: The data-collection package automatically writes the log files to the specified ACT LPS share.
segment.target: The data-collection package automatically writes the log files to the specified ACT LPS share.

segment.source: If the ACT LPS share is unavailable when the upload time interval is reached, the data-collection package will make two more attempts.
segment.target: If the ACT LPS share is unavailable when the upload time interval is reached, the data-collection package will make two more attempts.

segment.source: For inventory collector packages, after the third attempt, the inventory collector package no longer attempts to upload data.
segment.target: For inventory collector packages, after the third attempt, the inventory collector package no longer attempts to upload data.

segment.source: For runtime-analysis packages, if the problem persists, the runtime-analysis package will store the log file in %SYSTEMDRIVE%UsersAll UsersMicrosoftApplication Compatibility ToolkitLogProcessorFailed.
segment.target: For runtime-analysis packages, if the problem persists, the runtime-analysis package will store the log file in %SYSTEMDRIVE%UsersAll UsersMicrosoftApplication Compatibility ToolkitLogProcessorFailed.

segment.source: The runtime-analysis package will attempt to upload the files again at the next upload interval.
segment.target: The runtime-analysis package will attempt to upload the files again at the next upload interval.

segment.source: Select Local (%ACTAppData%DataCollectorOutput).
segment.target: Select Local (%ACTAppData%DataCollectorOutput).

segment.source: If you use this option, the data-collection package creates log files on the local system and the computer administrator must manually copy the files to the ACT LPS share location.
segment.target: If you use this option, the data-collection package creates log files on the local system and the computer administrator must manually copy the files to the ACT LPS share location.

segment.source: Consider this option for mobile users who are not always connected to the network.
segment.target: Consider this option for mobile users who are not always connected to the network.

segment.source: The log files are located in %SYSTEMDRIVE%UsersAll UsersMicrosoftApplication Compatibility ToolkitDataCollectorOutput.
segment.target: The log files are located in %SYSTEMDRIVE%UsersAll UsersMicrosoftApplication Compatibility ToolkitDataCollectorOutput.

segment.source: Type an alternate network share location.
segment.target: Type an alternate network share location.

segment.source: If you use this option, verify that the data-collection package can write to the alternate location.
segment.target: If you use this option, verify that the data-collection package can write to the alternate location.

segment.source: You might consider this option if your organization is geographically diverse.
segment.target: You might consider this option if your organization is geographically diverse.

segment.source: For example, administrators can create data-collection packages and file shares individually for each geographic location.
segment.target: For example, administrators can create data-collection packages and file shares individually for each geographic location.

segment.source: Administrators at a central location must then move the log files to a central location and map the files to the ACT LPS share for processing and entry into the ACT database.
segment.target: Administrators at a central location must then move the log files to a central location and map the files to the ACT LPS share for processing and entry into the ACT database.
